meanings.definition: A type of flowering plant native to North America.
meanings.sent1: The camases bloomed beautifully in the garden.
meanings.sent2: Many camases grow in the fields during spring.
meanings.sent3: The bees buzzed happily around the camases.
meanings.sent4: The camases swayed gently in the breeze like colorful dancers.
meanings.sent5: The fragrance of the camases filled the air with sweetness.

meanings.definition: The plural form of camas, a type of lily with edible bulbs.
meanings.sent1: We dug up the camases to harvest the bulbs.
meanings.sent2: The camases were delicious when cooked in a stew.
meanings.sent3: The chef prepared a special dish using camases.
meanings.sent4: The camases in the garden were like hidden treasures waiting to be found.
meanings.sent5: The camases added a lovely touch to the floral arrangement.

meanings.definition: To gather or harvest camas bulbs for food.
meanings.sent1: We need to camases before winter comes.
meanings.sent2: She camases with great care to avoid damaging the bulbs.
meanings.sent3: The family camases together for a festive meal.
meanings.sent4: He camases like a pro, knowing exactly which bulbs to pick.
meanings.sent5: Camasing in the fields under the sun was a joyful activity.
